Part A: Learning Preferences

For questions 1 through 10, of the 23 questions, please select the ONE of two choices in each question that best describes you personally. If both seem to apply to you, choose the one that applies more frequently. You are free to skip any question, though you are encouraged to complete them all.

Enter your Participant ID

1. I prefer to get new information in

Pictures, diagrams, graphs, or maps.

Spoken information
2. In a study group working on difficult material, I am more likely to

Jump in and contribute ideas.
Sit back and listen
3. In a book with lots of pictures and charts, I am likely to

Look over the pictures and charts carefully.

Focus on the written text.
4. I remember best

What I see

What I hear
5. I prefer to study

In a study group.

Alone.
6. When I see a diagram or sketch in class, I am most likely to remember

The picture.

What the instructor said about it.
7. When someone is showing me data, I prefer

Charts or graphs.

Text summarizing the results.
8. When I have to work on a group project, I first want to

Have "group brainstorming" where everyone contributes ideas

Brainstorm individually and then come together as a group to compare ideas.
9. When I am learning a new subject, I prefer to

Stay focused on that subject, learning as much about it as I can.

Try to make connections between that subject and related subjects.
10. The idea of doing homework in groups, then assigning one grade for the entire group,

Appeals to me

Does not appeal to me.
For questions 11 through 13 please select from the 6 options the one that best describes you.

As a learner you are
1Very Self-Directed

4Slightly Group-Directed

6Very Group-Directed

When you study, you
1Never Ask For Help
2Rarely Ask For Help
3Sometimes Ask For Help
4Often Ask For Help
5Usually Ask For Help
6Always Ask For Help

When working in groups, you
1Hate it
2Somewhat Hate it
3Slightly Hate it
4Slightly Love it
5Somewhat Love it
6Love it
